item.title: How to Copy a PICO-8 Game From a PocketCHIP
item.description: Information on how to copy a PICO-8 game from a PocketCHIP.

item.title: Setting up a Raspberry Pi 2 Samba server (in early January 2016)
item.description: Instructions on how to setup a Raspberry Pi 2 Samba server with a Seagate Backup Plus Slim 1TB.

item.title: Google Services on the Amazon Fire HD 8
item.description: For my future reference, information on how to install Google services (Google Play and associated services) on an Amazon Fire HD 8.

item.title: Windows 10 touchpad fix for the ASUS X200M
item.description: One possible way to fix an unresponsive touchpad on the ASUS X200M after a Windows 10 install.

item.title: Example libGDX orthographic camera controller
item.description: The following class can be used in a libGDX project as a framework for your own orthographic camera controller.

item.title: My Video Game Tracker (for Windows Phone 7) on GitHub
item.description: Yesterday morning I committed version 1.2 of My Video Game Tracker to a public repository on GitHub.

item.title: Windows Phone 7: Taking and restoring a SQL database
item.description: As I develop my first Windows Phone 7 application, My Video Game Tracker, I want to make sure that the many games I've added won't accidentally be lost (as I'm deploying test versions to my physical phone).

item.title: Migration from CollabNet Subversion to VisualSVN Server
item.description: Basic steps to migrate from CollabNet Subversion to VisualSVN Server.

item.title: On Web sites that feature Facebook Comments
item.description: Thoughts on Web sites that use Facebook to handle their comments.

item.title: Excellent news - the BlogML project is not dead.
item.description: While it seemed to be near death, if not dead, at least as far as new releases, the BlogML project is not dead, and has been undergoing a number of needed changes since the end of January.

item.title: Northwind Community Edition download
item.description: Where to download the scripts to setup Northwind manually.

item.title: RESTful WCF Web services, easily
item.description: WCF WebHttp Services is the best of ASP.NET MVC and WCF. Or at least that seems to be the case.

item.title: Dead? The digital download is barely out of its teens
item.description: Before embracing the digital media cloud, please let us embrace the promise of digital media, first, by allowing users a selection that would otherwise be unavailable.

item.title: Review: Beginning ASP.NET 4 In C# and VB
item.description: Review of Imar Spaanjaars' Beginning ASP.NET 4 in C# and VB.

item.title: iPod Touch, netbooks, laptops, and desktops
item.description: I want portability, but I don't want to pay a lot for it, or get crap because of it. Here's where my reasoning and research got me.
